results.headline: Pale Boy and Pale Vampire in a Still, Wintry Landscape

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Let the Right One In

results.summary_short: “Let the Right One In” takes the morbid unhappiness of its young characters seriously.

results.headline: Portrait of the Artist as a Global Soccer Star

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Zidane

results.summary_short: You learn little by way of hard facts about the adored French soccer star and famous head-butter Zinédine Zidane in the formalist exercise that bears his name.

results.headline: Campy Chills
results.display_title: The Gay Bed & Breakfast of Terror

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Gay Bed & Breakfast of Terror

results.summary_short: The heroes of “The Gay Bed & Breakfast of Terror” are so catty, obnoxious and generally unpleasant, you can’t wait for them to start getting hacked to bits.

results.headline: A Legal Tussle for Civil Rights

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Saving Marriage

results.summary_short: “Saving Marriage” is an in-the-trenches, defiantly partisan and exuberantly big-hearted movie.

results.headline: Life Inside

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of News From Home/News From House

results.summary_short: Amos Gitai gets a lot of mileage out of a small metaphor in the third film in which he looks at people who have lived in a house in West Jerusalem over the decades.

results.headline: An Artist With Enthusiasm

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Universe of Keith Haring

results.summary_short: Keith Haring was not a great artist. He might not even have been a very good one. But he was the right person in the right place at the right time.

results.headline: Peer Cruelty and Parental Frustration

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ben X

results.summary_short: There’s not a moment of warmth or ease in “Ben X,” Nic Balthazar’s punishingly cacophonous debut.

results.headline: Atrocities Magnified

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Soviet Story

results.summary_short: The filmmaking in “The Soviet Story” is so overwrought that at times the movie comes across as comical.

results.headline: A Band of Loyal Brothers, Not All of Them Honorable

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pride and Glory

results.summary_short: “Pride and Glory,” directed by Gavin O’Connor, plods across familiar ground. It’s yet another movie about the fraternal disorder of the police.

results.headline: Gay Wedding Bells

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Noah's Arc: Jumping the Broom

results.summary_short: The television series “Noah’s Arc” has yielded, “Sex and the City” style, its own feature: an agreeable melodrama unlikely to reach an audience beyond that of the show.

results.headline: An Antiwar Play on Film
results.display_title: Dalton Trumbo's Johnny Got His Gun

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dalton Trumbo's Johnny Got His Gun

results.summary_short: Staged plays just aren’t that cinematic, and even under the capable direction of Rowan Joseph, Ben McKenzie doesn’t provide enough spark to offset the problem.

results.headline: Omigosh, Real Guys Love Sports and Musical Theater

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of High School Musical 3: Senior Year

results.summary_short: How lovely the American high school experience might be if it offered even a smidgen of the euphoria in “High School Musical 3: Senior Year.”

results.headline: A Boy Gone, a Mother Scorned

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Changeling

results.summary_short: When it works best, “Changeling” is a feverish and bluntly effective parable of wronged innocence.

results.headline: When Survival Hinged on Team Spirit
results.display_title: Stranded: I've Come From a Plane That Crashed in the Mountains

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Stranded: I've Come From a Plane That Crashed in the Mountains

results.summary_short: Gonzalo Arijón’s documentary “Stranded” offers an incontrovertible argument for the necessity of team spirit in the face of catastrophe.

results.headline: From Fertile Sketchpads, Anxious Tales and Terrors

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fear(s) of the Dark

results.summary_short: “Fear(s) of the Dark” is an animated anthology that tells its stories with an inventiveness that’s seldom scary but never less than mesmerizing.

results.headline: A Tour of the Bay Area’s Immigrant Demimonde, Available on YouTube

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Princess of Nebraska

results.summary_short: Moments of obviousness are offset by a feeling of gritty lyricism in Wayne Wang’s “Princess of Nebraska,” a beautifully shot but awkwardly acted movie that is available only online.

results.headline: Oliver Stone’s Vision Thing: Bush, the Family

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of W.

results.summary_short: “W.” does something most journalism and even documentaries can’t or won’t do: it reminds us what a long, strange trip it’s been to the Bush White House.

results.headline: A High School Student With a Beard

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tru Loved

results.summary_short: Does the world need yet another peppy gay self-esteem indie like “Tru Loved”? Probably not, though the writer and director Stewart Wade pulls this one off with heart.

results.headline: There’s Something About Mary Magdalene

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mary

results.summary_short: “Mary” is a convoluted, hysterical mess of a movie with grandiose spiritual airs and not a drop of humor.

results.headline: Sparkling Seascapes and Shiny, Happy Faces

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Morning Light

results.summary_short: “Morning Light” is a sweepingly beautiful documentary unmoored by democratic intentions.
